summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey and attorney Jeff Jocks regarding a subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts for records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The correspondence reveals that Interlochen's records showed no tuition payments by Epstein or his entities, as their records are only kept for 7 years.

persons.name: Jeff Jocks
persons.role: Attorney for Interlochen Center for the Arts
persons.context: Attorney representing Interlochen Center for the Arts in responding to a federal subpoena seeking records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. He communicates that Interlochen has no records of Epstein payments.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Federal prosecutor with the Southern District of New York who is leading the inquiry and issuing the subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts for records on Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: George B. Donnini
persons.context: Attorney cc'd on the email correspondence regarding the subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts, suggesting involvement in the legal response.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the investigation, whose financial records and potential tuition payments to Interlochen Center for the Arts are being sought via subpoena.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Co-conspirator and associate of Jeffrey Epstein, also named in the subpoena for records from Interlochen Center for the Arts.

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney communicating about compliance with a federal subpoena regarding the Epstein investigation.
Both attorneys are involved in responding to the federal subpoena on behalf of Interlochen Center for the Arts.
Both are named as subjects of the investigation in the subpoena for records from Interlochen Center for the Arts.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to Interlochen
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey sends a subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts seeking information regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Interlochen's Final Response
events.description: Attorney Jeff Jocks confirms Interlochen Center for the Arts has no records of tuition payments by Epstein or his entities, as they only keep records for 7 years.

locations: Interlochen Center for the Arts (presumably in Interlochen, Michigan)
Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Traverse City, Michigan 49684 (Sondee, Racine & Doren, PLC office)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York subpoenaed Interlochen Center for the Arts for records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
Interlochen's attorney, Jeff Jocks, stated the institution only keeps tuition payment records for 7 years and found no records of payments by Epstein or his entities.
The subpoena and correspondence indicate an investigative line of inquiry into whether Epstein financially supported students at Interlochen.
The email chain shows repeated follow-ups by prosecutors over several months (February to October 2020) to secure a response to the subpoena.
The correspondence highlights the confidentiality of the subpoena request, as prosecutors asked Interlochen to keep it confidential.
